sense.name: informal term for father, dad
sense.examples: Johnny went to a ball game with his pop on Father's Day. They are just the regular moms and pops who raise their kids and pay their taxes. The old mom and pop grocery down the street finally went out of business.

sense.name: sweet carbonated beverage, soda
sense.examples: Mary blended orange pop with vanilla ice cream to make a freeze. The dentist told the children that drinking lots of pop was bad for their teeth. Calorie-free caffeine-free pop has become a billion dollar industry.

sense.name: small explosive noise
sense.examples: Several passengers reported hearing a pop near the left engine of the plane. Johnny blew up the balloon until it burst with a pop. We heard the pop of champagne corks in the next room.

sense.name: a genre of popular music, soft rock
sense.examples: The singer is a crossover artist between country and pop. John hates pop and mostly plays heavy metal.

sense.name: a general effort or attempt
sense.examples: At twenty dollars a pop, John gambled hundreds of dollars on the roulette wheel. With one pop, Bob swallowed a handful of vitamin pills.

sense.name: a high, shallow, easily caught baseball
sense.examples: The batter's pop to left field was caught to end the inning.
